arn.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the assessment.

assessmentReportsDestination.description: Assessment report storage destination configuration. See `assessment_reports_destination` below.

frameworkId.description: Unique identifier of the framework the assessment will be created from.

roles.description: List of roles for the assessment. See `roles` below.

rolesAlls.description: Complete list of all roles with access to the assessment. This includes both roles explicitly configured via the `roles` block, and any roles which have access to all Audit Manager assessments by default.

scope.description:
Amazon Web Services accounts and services that are in scope for the assessment. See `scope` below.

The following arguments are optional:

status.description: Status of the assessment. Valid values are `ACTIVE` and `INACTIVE`.

tags.description: A map of tags to assign to the assessment. If configured with a provider `default_tags` configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.

assessmentReportsDestination.description: Assessment report storage destination configuration. See `assessment_reports_destination` below.

frameworkId.description: Unique identifier of the framework the assessment will be created from.

roles.description: List of roles for the assessment. See `roles` below.

scope.description:
Amazon Web Services accounts and services that are in scope for the assessment. See `scope` below.

The following arguments are optional:

tags.description: A map of tags to assign to the assessment. If configured with a provider `default_tags` configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Assessment resources.

The following arguments are optional:

status.description: Status of the assessment. Valid values are `ACTIVE` and `INACTIVE`.

tags.description: A map of tags to assign to the assessment. If configured with a provider `default_tags` configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.
